description: From Latin abrāsus, perfect passive participle of abrādō (“abrade”), from ab (“from, away from”) + rādō (“scrape”).

entries.meaning: (obsolete) Rubbed smooth or blank. [Attested only in the 17th century.]

verbs.description: abrase (third-person singular simple present abrases, present participle abrasing, simple past and past participle abrased)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To wear down; rub clean; smoothen; abrade. [First attested in the late 15th century.]
